full_summary:
Tender Announcement
===============

Government of Canada
------------------

**Title:** Chemical Water Treatment Services

**Reference:** cb-297-39685205

**Solicitation Number:** 1000256240
**Publication Date:** 2024-02-01
**Closing Date:** 2024-03-12T14:00:00

### Description of the Requirement

Health Canada is seeking a contractor to provide Chemical Water Treatment Services for various mechanical equipment in the Sir Fredrick Banting Building, Laboratory Centre for Disease Control, Radiation Protection Building, and Occupational Health Unit.

The services will involve a period of two (2) years with three (3) one-year options. The contractor will be responsible for providing treatment services to ensure the water quality meets the required standards.

### Technical Requirements

The Services include:

* Maintenance and repair of mechanical equipment
* Replacement of spare parts and consumables
* Compliance with the Canadian Water Quality Guidelines
* Security clearance for contractors working on-site

### Security Requirements

All contractors must undergo a security clearance process, and access will be granted only to those who have been cleared. Signed Agreements will provide the security requirements detailed.

### Procurement Method

This is an open competitive process, with the lowest price being the deciding factor for contract award.

### Closing the Tender

Tenders should be submitted in writing to Christian Bélangner, Procurement Officer, no later than 14:00 hours on 2024-03-12 (EST). Late tenders will not be considered.

Please comply with the terms and conditions of this tender and submit your tenders via the following procedures.


**Attachments:**

Tender documents can be accessed through the Canada Buys website: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender\_notice/31007/1000256240-.pdf


Attachments:

* Amendment 1
* Amendment 2
* Request for Proposal
* Notice of Cancellation

**Contact Information**

Procurement Officer:
Christian Bélangner
christian.belanger@hc-sc.gc.ca
(613) 697-0681
